title: Creative Games
description: Games that unlock imagination, generate vision, and help teams dream boldly
philosophy: Creativity flourishes in play. When we let go of judgment and embrace possibility, we discover what we truly want to build.

games.name: Future Headlines
games.purpose: Generate vivid visions of project success by writing newspaper headlines from the future

team_size_adaptations.small: Each person writes 3-5 headlines, all share and discuss together
team_size_adaptations.medium: Pairs write headlines together, then share with full group
team_size_adaptations.large: Groups of 4-5 write headlines, representatives share with plenary

rules.instructions: Set the scene: 'Imagine it's 5 years from now. Your project has succeeded beyond your wildest dreams. Major publications are writing about it.'
rules.facilitator_notes: Create excitement and remove constraints. Emphasize there are no wrong answers.

rules.instructions: Each person writes 3-5 newspaper headlines about your project's success. Headlines should be specific, vivid, and capture what success looks like.
rules.facilitator_notes: Play upbeat music. Encourage bold thinking. Remind that headlines should feel exciting to read.

rules.instructions: Each person shares their favorite 1-2 headlines. No discussion yet - just listening and appreciation.
rules.facilitator_notes: Enforce the 'no discussion' rule. Encourage 'ooh' and 'aah' reactions.

rules.instructions: Everyone gets 3 votes. Vote for the headlines that most inspire you.
rules.facilitator_notes: Anonymous voting works best. Can vote for your own if truly inspired by it.

rules.instructions: AI facilitator identifies themes across top-voted headlines. Team discusses what these reveal about their shared vision.
rules.facilitator_notes: Look for: who is mentioned, what impact is described, what emotions are evoked

prompts: Imagine picking up The New York Times 5 years from today. What headline about your project would make you cry happy tears?
What would TechCrunch write about you that would make your competitors jealous?
What headline would make your users' lives so much better that they'd write thank-you letters?
What would your grandmother proudly clip from the paper to show her friends?
ai_facilitation.synthesis_instructions: Group headlines by theme (impact on users, technical achievement, team culture, industry disruption). Identify the 3-4 strongest themes. Note emotional patterns: what feelings do the best headlines evoke?
follow_up_questions: What themes appear across multiple headlines?
Which headline surprised you by resonating so strongly?
What would need to be true for this headline to happen?
Who are the heroes in these stories?

success_indicators: At least one headline gives everyone goosebumps

variations.name: Magazine Cover
variations.description: Instead of headlines, design a magazine cover including headline, subheadlines, and cover image description
variations.when_to_use: When team is more visually oriented or has more time

variations.name: Tweet Storm
variations.description: Write a thread of 5 tweets announcing your success, including the replies and reactions
variations.when_to_use: For teams building consumer products or with social media focus

games.connection_to_axiom_zero: This game builds trust by honoring everyone's vision without judgment. It expresses love by encouraging each person to dream of creating something valuable for humanity.

games.name: Stakeholder Safari
games.purpose: Discover stakeholder needs through empathetic role-play

team_size_adaptations.small: Each person role-plays 2-3 different stakeholders sequentially
team_size_adaptations.medium: Pairs role-play stakeholder interviews with each other
team_size_adaptations.large: Breakout rooms by stakeholder type, then synthesis plenary

rules.instructions: Brainstorm all possible stakeholders: users, customers, team members, partners, affected communities, future users, etc.
rules.facilitator_notes: Push for non-obvious stakeholders. Who is affected but not immediately visible?

rules.instructions: Each participant draws or chooses a stakeholder to embody. You will BE this person for the next exercise.
rules.facilitator_notes: Encourage people to pick stakeholders different from themselves.

rules.instructions: Get into character: What's this person's name? What's their daily life like? What keeps them up at night? What do they hope for?
rules.facilitator_notes: Encourage specificity. 'Sarah, 42, project manager at a mid-size company' not just 'a user'

rules.instructions: AI facilitator or human partner interviews each stakeholder. Stay in character! Answer from their perspective, not yours.
rules.facilitator_notes: Push past surface answers. Ask 'Why?' multiple times. Look for emotions.

rules.instructions: Each stakeholder shares their biggest hope and biggest fear regarding the project. Group identifies patterns.
rules.facilitator_notes: Capture exact language used. Note where stakeholder needs conflict or align.

prompts: As [stakeholder name], describe a typical frustrating day before our project exists.
What would make you trust a new solution in this space?
If this project succeeds wildly, how is your Tuesday different?
What's the thing no one asks you about, but really matters to you?
What would make you tell a friend about this?
ai_facilitation.synthesis_instructions: Map stakeholders on axes: (1) Impact they have on project success, (2) Impact project has on them. Identify primary beneficiaries and key influencers. Note where stakeholder needs create tension.
follow_up_questions: Whose voice was missing from our safari?
How might we serve all these needs simultaneously?

outputs: Stakeholder map with needs and motivations
success_indicators: Team develops genuine empathy for stakeholders
Team can articulate stakeholder needs in stakeholder's words

variations.name: Stakeholder Fishbowl
variations.description: 3-4 people role-play stakeholders in the center while others observe and take notes, then swap
variations.when_to_use: Larger teams, or when wanting deeper observation

variations.name: Future Stakeholder
variations.description: Include stakeholders who don't exist yet - future users, next-generation team members, affected communities 10 years out
variations.when_to_use: Long-term projects, or when sustainability is a key value

games.connection_to_axiom_zero: This game is pure love in action - stepping into another's shoes to understand their needs. It builds trust by demonstrating that we care about everyone affected by our work.

games.name: Dream Demo
games.purpose: Envision the ideal product demonstration without technical constraints

team_size_adaptations.small: One collaborative demo story told together, adding to each other's ideas
team_size_adaptations.medium: 2-3 parallel demo visions, then combine best elements
team_size_adaptations.large: Breakout groups create demos, then 'demo-off' with voting

rules.instructions: Imagine you have a magic wand. All technical constraints vanish. Cost, time, physics - all flexible. What would you build?
rules.facilitator_notes: Really emphasize there are NO constraints. If they say 'but we can't...' remind them of the magic wand.

rules.instructions: Write the script for a 3-minute demo of your project. What does the presenter show? How does the audience react? What 'wow moment' happens?
rules.facilitator_notes: Encourage theatrical details. The audience gasps when... The user smiles because...

rules.instructions: Each person/group performs their dream demo. Others play the amazed audience.
rules.facilitator_notes: Encourage applause, gasps, questions. Make it fun!

rules.instructions: What features appeared in multiple demos? What 'wow moments' resonated most?
rules.facilitator_notes: Look for the essential magic, not just flashy features.

prompts: You're on stage at the biggest tech conference. What moment makes the audience cheer?
A skeptic in the audience becomes a believer. What did they see?
Someone in the audience is moved to tears (happy tears). Why?
The demo goes viral. What 10-second clip gets shared?
ai_facilitation.synthesis_instructions: Extract core value propositions from dream demos. Identify which 'magic' features might be achievable and which represent north-star aspirations. Note emotional peaks in the demos.
follow_up_questions: What's the essence of the magic in our demos?
Which 'impossible' features might actually be possible?
What would a 'minimum lovable product' include from these dreams?
How do we preserve the emotional impact with real constraints?

success_indicators: Demos include emotional resonance, not just features
Team is excited to build toward this vision

variations.name: Reverse Demo
variations.description: Demo the problem first (before your solution exists), then demo the solution. Maximize the contrast.
variations.when_to_use: When the problem isn't well understood or agreed upon

variations.name: User Story Demo
variations.description: Demo follows a specific user through a day, showing how your product transforms their experience
variations.when_to_use: When user experience is the primary differentiator

games.connection_to_axiom_zero: Dreaming together builds trust - we see each other's hopes and find common ground. Love drives us to imagine something worth building for others.
